title: Towards Making GRID-enabled Schools eScience Usable and Reusable for and with Teachers
abstractText:
This project explores the usability issues around putting Grid-enabled e-Science technologies into the hands of teachers and learners.

The key objectives are:

  • To develop new e-Science communities involving science teachers and pupils and in so doing to explore the barriers and usability issues in the design of e-Science systems 
  • To expose young people to the possibilities of e-Science as a natural way of engaging in scientific research. 
  • To increase our understanding of the ways in which new knowledge is formulated and understood within an educational context supported by e-Science technology.

A participatory user-centred approach will be used to explore how teachers can successfully integrate sensor-based data collection and visualisation technologies into the secondary school science curriculum, and engage in Grid-enabled e-Science work across a global community.

This will involve four phases, each culminating in live trials:

  • The first stage is working with one teacher to develop data collection/visualisation tools and class activities for a particular science curriculum area
  • The second and third phases expands this to include collaboration with another UK school, and then with a non-UK school
  • The fourth phase is developing guidelines and supporting teachers to re-use the technologies and methods in different science curriculum areas or with different class groups.
